main event: On the night of August 5, 1952, personnel at Haneda AFB in Japan observed a circular object with constant brilliance over Tokyo Bay for about an hour. The object was tracked by ground radar and was unsuccessfully intercepted by an F-94 fighter jet.
interesting points: Two airmen first spotted the object while walking to the control tower,The object was described as circular with a dark shape about four times its diameter,It was observed through 7x50 binoculars and appeared to have multiple dim lights along its lower edge,The radar tracked the object at varying speeds up to 300 knots,The object occasionally faded from view and reappeared, which led observers to speculate about its movement.
sighted object: a circular object with constant brilliance
witness description: AF personnel, including airmen and control tower operators
